Description: Fragment of handle and neck of Rhodian pottery transport amphora with rectangular stamp; handle turns down sharply. Clay fine, fine pores, some very small mica, beige to light orange. Rectangular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Production date: 203 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Name Theuphanes. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, CEALEX MAR 103.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0676)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 2002.91 (Former Incorrect MFA accession No.)
Miscellaneous number: Cls.Inv.31 (Former MFA FIC/INV No.)
Miscellaneous number: P.5820 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
